Title: SpiralClock
Description: SpiralClock is a UserControl developed in WPF that allows you to arrange events on a 24h spiral clock. It can be templated.
HomeWiki:
Project Description

This is a spiral clock made entirely in WPF & C#, which can be used as a time - scheduler. Events are arranged along the Archimedean spiral and can easily be moved by dragging them with the mouse. Spiral clock is fully template-able, as it inherits from Selector. The time-now-indicator and the hour labels are also template-able.

The first release contains the control source and a demo project as well.


NEWS: An enhanced SpiralClock will be uploaded soon, inheriting from the ListoBox class.
In addition, a new control will be included : the stripes panel, that makes a stripe in a vertical area, depending on a time value.



Note: The spiral vector contained in the project was based on the svg found here: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Archimedean_spiral.svg and is therefore under the Creative Commons Attribution-Share Alike 2.5 Generic License. Usage of this control must be in compliance with that license or else you can remove the spiral background - the control works fine without it.
